scripting
Interface ScriptingEngine

All Known Implementing Classes:
PythonEngine
public interface ScriptingEngine

The common interface for all scripting engines used by ScriptingEngineManager and ScriptBottleneck

Author:
Curran Kelleher

Method Summary
 void exec(java.lang.String script)
          Executes the script in this interpreter
 java.lang.String getFileExtension()
          Gets the file extension of script files in the language of this engine.

          Returns the name of the language.

          Imports the specified Java class in the interpreter of the specified language if the class is not already defined.

          Wraps the specified callback function in to a Function object.
 

Method Detail

getLanguageName

java.lang.String getLanguageName()
Returns the name of the language. For example, "python"

getFileExtension

java.lang.String getFileExtension()
Gets the file extension of script files in the language of this engine. For example, "py"

getFunctionBaseClasses

java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> getFunctionBaseClasses()
Returns:
the list of the base classes for classes which are functions passed in from the language of this engine

exec

void exec(java.lang.String script)
Executes the script in this interpreter

Parameters:
script -

importIfNotDefined

void importIfNotDefined(java.lang.String fullPackageName,
                        java.lang.String className)
Imports the specified Java class in the interpreter of the specified language if the class is not already defined.

Parameters:
fullPackageName - the full name of the package containing the class to import. For example "javax.swing"
className - the name of the class to import. For example, "JButton"

wrapFunction

Function wrapFunction(java.lang.Object callbackFunction)
Wraps the specified callback function in to a Function object.

Parameters:
callbackFunction - the function, as it is when it is passed into Java from the scripting language
Returns:
the wrapped function
